# Chord: sus4 in F# (Shape: G)

## Overview
The sus4 chord in the key of F# is created by replacing the third of the chord with the fourth degree of the scale. When played in G shape, it gives a unique flavor to the chord, adding tension and a sense of movement that can lead back to the major chord or resolve in other ways.

## Notes and Intervals
In the G shape of the sus4 chord in F#, the notes and intervals are as follows:
- F# (Root)
- B (4th)
- C# (5th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The sus4 chord in F# played in G shape is commonly found in various genres such as folk, pop, and rock. It adds a sense of anticipation and color to the progression, creating a unique harmonic quality that can help to build tension and drama in the music. This chord is often used in intros, transitions, or as a way to add interest to a simple chord progression.
